intro: Hedyotis cephalotes, commonly known as the golden thread or small red root, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, bright yellow flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
